Dear Harry:
It is impossible for me to personally get to Rimini this year to represent
NAEB at the Prix Italia. I believe that I previously indicated to you that
there are no funds available and since I have already been abroad once
this year, I cannot see my way clear to assume an expenditure out of
personal funds. I have therefore designated Bernard Buck to represent
NAEB at the General Assembly and have so indicated to the Secretary-
General.
We have this year submitted one work in the documentary classification
entitled, "Sounds of My City" which is the closest approximation to the
actuality concept of the European Broadcasting organizations that I know
of. I am optimistic about our chances.
We have also submitted one musical work, "The Ruby" by Norman del Joio,
sent to us by Elmer Sulzer of the University of Indiana. Altogether there
were some dozen entries from NAEB stations this year, which is a marked
increase in interest over last year. It is unfortunate that the Jury did not
consider these of sufficient competitive excellence to warrant the comÂ¬
paratively large expenditure in submitting these works. Parenthetically,
the $100 expenditure for translation alone, is only one fractional cost.
Postage for the transmission of the tapes which has been borne by WNYC
is in excess of $60. Other costs of getting juries together, lunches, etc.
will give you some idea of the magnitude of the single operation of merely
submitting what hopefully may bring a commensurate return.
I am sending to you under separate cover two copies of the English and French
Scripts for both entries. Copies are/hlso being sent to the members of
the International Relations Committee and to Frank Schooley. Entrants of
the unsuccessful musical and dramatic w/orks are being notified.
With all best wishe
